meanings.definition: A detailed written study or essay on a single subject or aspect of a subject.
meanings.sent1: The library had many monographs on ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent2: She wrote a monograph on the life of bees for her science class.
meanings.sent3: The detective's monograph on the mysterious case was both informative and entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her monograph on the stars shone brightly among other academic works.
meanings.sent5: The professor's monograph on plants was so vivid, it felt like walking through a garden.

meanings.definition: A scholarly work or publication on a single subject.
meanings.sent1: The university press published a series of monographs on history.
meanings.sent2: Students were required to read a monograph on climate change for their assignment.
meanings.sent3: The monograph on cheese-making was surprisingly captivating.
meanings.sent4: His monograph on politics painted a vivid picture of the current state of affairs.
meanings.sent5: The author's monograph on birds made their behavior come alive on the pages.
